title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 41): Resource Mapping & Infrastructure Weaving - Building Resilient Networks of Power With
summary: A guide to participatory resource mapping and infrastructure weaving that makes invisible community assets visible and connects them into resilient systems.

Community.summary: Map and weave together existing community resources to create resilient networks of mutual support and shared infrastructure.

level0: Form a cooperative mapping circle with diverse community members
Conduct storytelling walks and asset identification sessions
Practice participatory mapping methods using paper maps or simple tools
level1: Map physical, social, informational, and digital community resources
Include marginalized voices and center lived experience in mapping process
Begin weaving connections between mapped assets and resources
level2: Create resource sharing networks and infrastructure activation projects
Use technology thoughtfully to connect networks while maintaining community ownership
Test and adapt infrastructure based on community feedback and needs
level3: Connect multiple mapping nodes in federated but autonomous network
Support formation of additional resource mapping circles in other areas
Build lasting infrastructure for community-controlled resource coordination

Knowledge.summary: Develop and share knowledge about participatory mapping, asset-based organizing, and community infrastructure development.

level0: Learn about asset-based community development and participatory mapping methods
Study successful community mapping projects like OCTOPI and Grassroots Economic Organizing
level1: Practice facilitating inclusive mapping sessions and asset identification processes
Document your mapping circle's methods and community agreements
Learn about community-controlled data and technology sovereignty
level2: Host workshops on resource mapping and infrastructure weaving
Create open-source tools and resources for community mapping
Share knowledge with other mapping circles and asset-based organizers
level3: Develop comprehensive community mapping organizing toolkits
Research and document impacts of participatory vs extractive mapping approaches
Train facilitators in other communities starting mapping processes

Narrative.summary: Challenge scarcity narratives while promoting stories of abundance, interconnection, and community resilience.

level0: Share stories about hidden community assets and existing mutual aid networks
Challenge deficit-based narratives about communities and neighborhoods
Practice seeing abundance and interconnection rather than scarcity and isolation
level1: Document community assets and success stories through mapping processes
Challenge extractive approaches to community data and resource documentation
Share stories of successful resource sharing and infrastructure weaving
level2: Lead community conversations about abundance, assets, and collective capacity
Create media highlighting community-controlled resource networks
Advocate for asset-based rather than deficit-based community development approaches
level3: Contribute to cultural shift toward recognizing community assets and abundance
Develop and share analysis of resource mapping as liberation practice
Support movements for community-controlled development and infrastructure
